tourBios.exmtStatus: Conditionally Exempt / 66th qualifier from Qualifying Tournament, Money List 61-100
tourBios.carHigh: 2011: Made the cut in 12 of 22 starts during his first full season on Tour. Best finish was a T25 at the Midwest Classic. Made headlines by turning professional at age 17. 2007: Was in the spotlight at the U.S. Open when he became the second-youngest golfer in the history of the tournament. Had to withdraw after the opening round due to a wrist injury.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Was ranked as the No. 2 junior in 2006 and was runner-up to Phillip Francis at the U.S. Junior Amateur...Attended Hamilton High School in Chandler, AZ, and won a state championship in 2006.
tourBios.personal: Lists Adam Schriber, Kent Chase and his father as instructors...Favorite course is Oakmont CC and would like to play Bethpage State Park's Black Course. Favorite TV show is "Entourage," and "The Hangover" is his favorite movie. The Hobbit is his favorite book. Enjoys Korean food. Kobe Bryant is his favorite athlete to watch. Los Angeles is his favorite city to visit, and his favorite vacation spots are Fiji and Hawaii...Never travels without sunglasses and his chopsticks...Would put Tiger Woods, Ben Hogan and Arnold Palmer in his dream foursome...Not many people know he's good at soccer...Father, Jeff, was a roommate of PGA TOUR pro K.J. Choi during their time on the Korean Tour...Carries beef jerky in his bag for a snack.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour was T25th in 2011 at the Midwest Classic Presented by Time Warner Cable.
